column1: 2 ^ Nōtus in Jūdaeā Deus; in Isrāēle magnum nōmen ejus. ^ In Judea God is known; his name is great in Israel.
3 ^ Et factus est in pāce locus ejus
column2: et habitātiō ejus in Sion. ^ And his place is in peace

column4: et bellum. ^ There hath he broken the powers of bows

column1: 5 ^ Illūminans tū mīrābiliter ā montibus aeternīs. ^ Thou enlightenest wonderfully from the everlasting hills.
6 ^ Turbātī sunt omnēs insapientēs corde; dormīvērunt somnum suum
column2: et nihil invēnērunt omnēs virī dīvitiārum in manibus suīs. ^ All the foolish of heart were troubled; they have slept their sleep
column3: and all the men of riches have found nothing in their hands.
dormītāvērunt quī ascendērunt equōs. ^ At thy rebuke
column5: they have all slumbered that mounted on horseback.

column2: et quis resistet tibi? Ex tunc īra tua. ^ Thou art terrible
column3: and who shall resist thee? From that time is thy wrath.

column1: 9 ^ Dē caelō audītum fēcistī jūdicium; terra tremuit et quiēvit
column2: ^ Thou hast caused judgment to be heard from heaven; the earth trembled and was still
ut salvōs faceret omnēs mansuētōs terrae. ^ when God arose in judgment
column3: to save all the meek of the earth.

column2: et reliquiae cōgitātiōnis diem fēstum agent tibi. ^ For the thought of man shall give praise to thee
column3: and the remainders of the thought shall keep holiday to thee.

column1: 12 ^ Vovēte et reddite Dominō Deō vestrō; omnēs quī in circumitū ejus affertis mūnera terribilī
column3: and pay to the Lord your God; all you that are round about him bring presents to him that is terrible

column1: 13 ^ et eī quī aufert spīritum prīncipum; terribilī apud rēgēs terrae. ^ and to him who taketh away the spirit of princes; to the terrible before the kings of the earth.
